meanings.definition: To depict or represent in a work of art or literature.
meanings.sent1: The artist will portray a beautiful sunset in her painting.
meanings.sent2: She used words to portray the scene vividly in her novel.
meanings.sent3: The cartoonist decided to portray the politician as a funny clown.
meanings.sent4: Her brushstrokes portrayed a sense of calmness in the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The author's words portrayed the bustling city with great detail.

meanings.definition: To describe or represent in words.
meanings.sent1: The journalist will portray the event in his article.
meanings.sent2: He portrayed his feelings through his heartfelt letter.
meanings.sent3: The children's book aimed to portray complex ideas in a simple way.
meanings.sent4: Her poem portrayed the beauty of nature in a unique light.
meanings.sent5: The speech successfully portrayed the importance of unity.

meanings.definition: To play the role of a character in a performance.
meanings.sent1: The actor will portray the brave knight in the play.
meanings.sent2: She portrayed the villain with great intensity on stage.
meanings.sent3: The comedian will portray a clumsy detective in the movie.
meanings.sent4: His performance portrayed a wide range of emotions effectively.
meanings.sent5: The actress portrayed the character's struggles with authenticity.
